title: Pseudo-classes
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/selectors/#pseudo-classes
are
keywords
b

which allow selection based on information that lies outside of the document tree or that cannot be expressed by other selectors or combinators. This information can be associated to a certain state (
state
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/selectors/#UIstates
and
dynamic
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/selectors/#dynamic-pseudos
pseudo-classes), to locations (
structural
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/selectors/#structural-pseudos
and
target
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/selectors/#target-pseudo
pseudo-classes), to negations of the former (
negation
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/selectors/#negation
pseudo-class) or to languages (
lang
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/selectors/#lang-pseudo
pseudo-class). Examples include whether or not a link has been followed (
:visited
c
), the mouse is over an element (
:hover
c
), a checkbox is checked (
:checked
c
), etc.

pseudo-classes), to negations of the former (

title:
Name | Description |
–– | ———– |
:active
c
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-selectors/#the-user-action-pseudo-classes-hover-act
| Applies to any element being activated (i.e. clicked) by the user. |
:any
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:any
| Allows you to build sets of related selectors by creating groups that the included items will match. This is an alternative to repeating an entire selector. |
:target
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:target
| Selects the current active #news element (clicked on a URLcontaining that anchor name) |
:checked
c
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-selectors/#checked
| Applies to radio, checkbox, or option elements that are checkedor toggled into an “on” state. |
:default
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:default
| Represents any user interface element that is the default among a group ofsimilar elements. |
:disabled
c
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-selectors/#enableddisabled
| Applies to any UI element which is in a disabled state. |
:empty
c
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/selectors/#empty-pseudo
| Applies to any element which has no children. |
:enabled
c
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-selectors/#enableddisabled
| Applies to any UI element which is in an enabled state. |
:first
c
a
http://tympanus.net/codrops/css_reference/first
| Used in conjunction with the
@page
c
rule, this selects the first page in aprinted document. |
:first-child
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:first-child
| Represents any element that is the first child element of its parent. |
:first-of-type
c
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-selectors/#first-of-type-pseudo
| Applies when an element is the first of the selected element typeinside its parent. This may or may not be the first-child. |
:focus
c
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-selectors/#the-user-action-pseudo-classes-hover-act
| Applies to any element which has the user’s focus. This can be given by theuser’s keyboard, mouse events, or other forms of input. |
:focus-within
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:focus-within
| Can be used to highlight a whole section when one element inside it is focused. It matches any element that the :focus pseudo-class matches or that has a descendant focused. |
:full-screen
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:fullscreen
| Applies to any element displayed in full-screen mode. It selects the whole stackof elements and not just the top level element. |
:hover
c
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-selectors/#the-user-action-pseudo-classes-hover-act
| Applies to any element being hovered by the user’s pointing device, butnot activated. |
:indeterminate
c
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-selectors/#indeterminate
| Applies radio or checkbox UI elements which are neither checked norunchecked, but are in an indeterminate state. This can be due to anelement’s attribute or DOM manipulation. |
:in-range
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:in-range
| The
:in-range
c

CSS pseudo-class matches when an element hasits value attribute inside the specified range limitations for this element.It allows the page to give a feedback that the value currently definedusing the element is inside the range limits. |
:invalid
c
a
http://tympanus.net/codrops/css_reference/invalid/
| Applies to
<input>
c
elements whose values are invalid according tothe type specified in the
type=
c
attribute. |
:lang
c
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-selectors/#lang-pseudo
| Applies to any element who’s wrapping
<body>
c
element has a properlydesignated
lang=
c
attribute. For the pseudo-class to be valid, it mustcontain a
valid two or three letter language code.
a
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes
:last-child
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:last-child
| Represents any element that is the last child element of its parent. |
:last-of-type
c
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-selectors/#last-of-type-pseudo
| Applies when an element is the last of the selected element type insideits parent. This may or may not be the last-child. |
:left
c
a
http://tympanus.net/codrops/css_reference/left_pseudo-class/
| Used in conjunction with the
@page
c
rule, this selects all the leftpages in a printed document. |
:link
c
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-selectors/#the-link-pseudo-classes-link-and-visited
| Applies to any links which haven’t been visited by the user. |
:not()
c
a
https://www.w3.org/wiki/CSS/Selectors/pseudo-classes/:not
| Applies to all elements which
do not
b
match the value passed to(
:not(p)
c
or
:not(.class-name)
c
for example. It must have a value to bevalid and it can only contain one selector. However, you can chain multiple
:not
c
selectors together. |
:nth-child
c
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-selectors/#nth-child-pseudo
| Applies when an element is the
n
c
-th element of its parent, where
n
c
can be an integer, a mathematical expression (e.g
n+3
c
) or the keywords
odd
c
or
even
c
:nth-of-type
c
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-selectors/#nth-of-type-pseudo
| Applies when an element is the
n
c
-th element of its parent of thesame element type, where
n
c
can be an integer, a mathematicalexpression (e.g
n+3
c
) or the keywords
odd
c
or
even
c
:only-child
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:only-child
| The
:only-child
c
CSS pseudo-class represents any elementwhich is the only child of its parent. This is the same as
:first-child:last-child
c
or
:nth-child(1):nth-last-child(1)
c
,but with a lower specificity. |
:optional
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:optional
| The
:optional
c
CSS pseudo-class represents any elementthat does not have the required attribute set on it. This allowsforms to easily indicate optional fields and to style them accordingly. |
:out-of-range
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:out-of-range
| The
:out-of-range
c

CSS pseudo-class matches when an element has itsvalue attribute outside the specified range limitations for this element.It allows the page to give a feedback that the value currently defined using theelement is outside the range limits. A value can be outside of a range if it iseither smaller or larger than maximum and minimum set values. |
:placeholder-shown
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:placeholder-shown
Experimental.
b
Applies to any form element currently displaying placeholder text. |
:read-only
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:read-only
| Applies to any element which is not editable by the user. |
:read-write
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:read-write
| Applies to any element that is editable by a user, such as
<input>
c
elements. |
:right
c
a
http://tympanus.net/codrops/css_reference/right_pseudo-class
| Used in conjunction with the
@page
c
rule, this selects all the right pages in aprinted document. |
:root
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:root
| matches the root element of a tree representing the document. |
:scope
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:scope
| CSS pseudo-class matches the elements that are a referencepoint for selectors to match against. |
:target
c
a
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:target
| Selects the current active #news element (clicked on a URLcontaining that anchor name) |
:visited
c
a
https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-selectors/#the-link-pseudo-classes-link-and-visited
| Applies to any links which have has been visited by the user. |

title: The :visited pseudoclass can’t be used for most styling in a lot of modern browsers anymore because it’s a security hole. See this link for reference.

inline_content.Text: The :visited pseudoclass can’t be used for most styling in a lot of modern browsers anymore because it’s a security hole. See this link for reference.
